Join us in celebrating senior Eugene Pronio! 🎓 🎉

After a traumatic brain injury caused him to miss out on a lot of his previous schooling, Eugene turned to the flexibility of cyber education, which allowed him to thrive on his own terms. 💻 📚

He was a member of National Honor Society, Reach Cyber’s Steering Committee, participated in the statewide Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PennDOT) Innovations Challenge, and composed original works of poetry for Reach Cyber’s Literary Magazine. 👍 👍

Focused on his future, Eugene will follow his passion for writing at his local community college with plans of transferring to the University of Pittsburgh after earning his Associate’s Degree.

Congratulations and best of luck with your next adventure, Eugene!

Dear families,

I cannot begin to imagine the emotions we each feel in this moment (or those leading to this time), but what I can do is confirm our commitment to you and the ideals we strive for as a school community. We cannot remain silent. As a school community, we are here for each other, and more than ever we need to reach out to our friends and neighbors and show the compassion, empathy, and humanity everyone deserves.

I should be clear that hatred and racism have no home at our school. Bigotry, bullying, or discrimination will not be tolerated. We treasure and hold dear the relationships that create our unique community -- those between teacher, student, and parent, all to support students’ academic and personal growth.

For students who want and need additional support at this time, I encourage you to reach out to your school counselor.

With Gratitude,
Jane Swan, CEO

Communication Skills for Business (CSB) and Entrepreneurship and Small Business are two of our newest certification programs that will be offered to Reach Cyber Charter School students next school year! ✔️

While the key skill being taught in CSB is communication, students will also learn the other three of "the four C’s:"
* Critical thinking -- which will happen as they think through how to effectively communicate
* Collaboration -- which will stem from effectively communicating with others
* Creativity -- which is required to present appealing communications

Whether students are starting a landscaping company or launching the next billion dollar startup ESB, these programs validate a students' understanding of core business principles, including the essentials needed to launch and maintain a successful business. 👏👏

We are excited to offer these -- and MANY more -- certification programs at Reach Cyber Charter School. Enrollment for 2020-21 is open now!

We are committed to providing our students the tools necessary to explore and achieve their career goals. High school students can now choose to complete a career-focused program of study while working toward graduation, thereby increasing their skills and employability.

Our new partnership with Credly helps us to make career development a top priority.

Through this digital platform, students will have the opportunity to build a digital portfolio of their experiences and certifications by earning badges in six pathways: Arts and Communications, Business Administration, STEM, Health Science, Human Services, and Information Technology.

Reach will also be offering a plethora of certification courses as a part of this career pathway initiative. The list includes, but is not limited to:

- Microsoft Office Specialist
- Microsoft Technology Associate
- Entrepreneurship and Communication Skills for Business

To learn more about the partnership and program, please visit https://cacademy.online/3epWLgF
